chunks.original_latin:
THEODGAUDI, GUNTHARII ET ARDUICI
EPISTOLA AD HINCMARUM.
chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
<speak>
   The Letter of Theodgaudus, Guntharius, and Arduicus to Hincmar. 
<break time="1s"/>
</speak>

To our beloved brother in Christ, Hincmarus: Theodgaudus, Primate of Belgic Gaul, Guntharius of Cologne, and Arduicus, Bishops of the Church of Besancon, send greetings and peace.

We have re-read, brother, and we hope, brother Hincmarus, your accusation against Hilduin, our beloved son and brother, whom we believe to be a worthy man. In it, you assert that he is unfit for pastoral duties and you claim to know the reasons why he should not be ordained. Despite this, you should have refrained or at least tempered your actions, considering that he was your dear master and nurturer-if you had wished to remember and not be ungrateful-whose name and kinship he bears.

Now, since you have chosen to be an accuser, do not leave the matter unfinished. You have stripped yourself of judgment by rashly handing your accusation document, which we think did not suit your office and honor, to our prince Lothair during a royal assembly, with your own hand, which you cannot deny. This has made Hilduin and us equally regarded with suspicion. Therefore, because you promised to prove your accusations, it follows that you must carry out what you promised.

We therefore urge you with canonical authority to proceed with the execution of your accusation in a canonical manner. If you withdraw from the accusation and fail to provide proof, know that you will be subject to the canonical rules for accusers. The false charges you tried to cover with synodal decrees will reflect back on you and your nephew of the same name, who have both been advanced. Neither of you was from the church where he is known to have been enthroned by ambition and favor of the powerful.

Under these circumstances, you will be required to attend the synod, which will be held in March in the city of Metz, with the grace of Christ favoring us. There, the aforementioned brother will either be convicted by your proof or freed by his own defense.
chunks.original_latin:
Optabili in Christo fratri IGMARO 
THEODGAUDUS primas Belgicae Galliae, GUNTHARIUS
Agrippinensis Coloniae, et ARDUICUS Vesontionensis
Ecclesiae episcopi salutem et pacem. Relegimus, frater, et utinam frater Igmare, libellum
tuae accusationis adversus Hilduinum dilectum
filium et fratrem nostrum, ut credimus idoneum
virum, in quo ipsum officio pastorali indignum asseveras,
et causas te scire, pro quibus isdem electus
ordinari non debeat, exclamas. Quamvis ab hac
improbitate hoc solummodo te revocare vel temperare
debuisset, quod ille tuus domnus et nutritor
fuerit charus, si tamen memor et non ingratus fore
voluisses, cujus iste et affinitatem refert et nomen. Nunc quoniam delator esse voluisti, quod restat non
 omittas. Te enim exspoliasti judicio, dum criminationis
chartulam, quod tuo officio et honori, ut
aestimamus, non competebat, propria manu, quod
negare non potes, in conventu regum principi
nostro Lothario inconsulte porrexisti, ac memoratum
Hilduinum, nosque pariter suspectos reddidisti. Ergo quia te objecta probaturum promisisti,
consequens est, ut exsequaris quae promisisti:
unde et te canonica commonemus auctoritate, ut
accusationis tuae exsecutionem canonice prosequaris. Quod si te accusationi subtraxeris, et probationi
defueris, noveris te canonicis de accusatoribus
regulis subjacere. Calumniae vero quas synodalibus
decretis obumbrare nisus es, in te atque in aequivocum
nepotem tuum, qui ita provecti estis reflectuntur. Quorum neuter ex illa fuit ecclesia, in qua
ambitione atque favore potentatus inthronizatus esse
dignoscitur. Hac conditione dehinc exigente synodo
te adesse oportebit, quae Idus Martias apud urbem
Mediomatricum, Christi favente gratia, celebrabitur:
ubi saepefatus frater aut tua probatione convincatur,
 aut sua defensione liberetur.

chunks.cleaned_english_translation: We may be able to respond to your concerns by addressing everything you've advised and criticized about the church of Cambrai. We wish you well in Christ.
chunks.original_latin:
Ubi quoque
et nos tibi ex omnibus, quae de ecclesia Cameracensi
scribens monuisti et reprehendisti, rationes
reddendo respondere valeamus. In Christo te valere
optamus.
